required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Identification of Stroke at the Emergency Medical Dispatch Center
clinical_study.official_title: Identification of Stroke at the Emergency Medical Dispatch Center

brief_summary.textblock: A study to investigate how stroke is identified and whether FAST, face-arm-speech test, is used in the emergency medical dispatch centre in Stockholm. The study will also investigate when FAST is used, does it increase the identification of stroke? And if other factors can be identified as "markers" for more effective identification of stroke during the emergency call.

detailed_description.textblock: Transcribed alarm calls are read through and analyzed using a qualitative method. Meaningful units are identified, coded and categorized. A phenomenological analysis is also applied to a separate analysis.

primary_outcome.description: A data collection tool assessing the frequency of stroke symptoms will be developed. The data collection tool will identify stroke symptoms presented by the caller during emergency calls and assess stroke symptoms in the Face-Arm-Speech-Time Test (FAST). Stroke symptoms will then be quantified into percentages for a descriptive analysis.

study_pop.textblock: Patients who has called the emergency medical dispatch centre and also are diagnosed as stroke at Södersjukhuset during the study period.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients who has called the emergency medical dispatch centre and also are diagnosed as stroke at Södersjukhuset during the study period.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Cases where needed documents and files are missing.

overall_official.affiliation: Karolinska Institutet, Intitution of clinical science and education, Södersjukhuset

facility.name: Karolinska Institutet, Intitution of clinical science and education, Södersjukhuset
